Distrain.definition: to force or compel to satisfy an obligation by means of a distress 2
Distrain.origin: [Anglo-French destreindre , literally, to constrict, force, from Old French, from Late Latin distringere to hinder, punish, from Latin, to pull in different directions, distract, from dis - apart + stringere to draw tight]

1.definition: to force or compel to satisfy an obligation by means of a distress

2.definition: to seize by distress compareto levy a distress
